Entries.default:
"Ahoy there. I take it you missed me?"

With one foot back and his arms to his sides like wings, the blue orlan bows deeply.
"Get your things and report to [Player Ship]."
"Not now, no."
"Decide you need my help after all?"
"What advantages would you bring my crew?"

"Aye-aye, captain!"

He snaps out a salute.

"Fair enough, captain."

He nods, a slight crease furrowing his brow.
"You asking aside from my vaunted shiphunting abilities, self-evident manners, and cyclopedic knowhow of all things piratical?" Teeth glint between the curves of his smile.
"If shit goes belly-up, I've got me a mind sharp enough to slice, and I ain't half-bad with a bullet."
"Adding to that, I be right easy on the eyes, or so the lasses tell me." He raises his eyebrows in two quick bumps.
Serafen glares openly, hands on his hips, and spits at his feet as you approach.

"We be needing words, Captain Watcher."

Serafen stands with arms crossed, ears angled down, blue fur standing on end. He eyes have narrowed to yellow-green slits.
"I don't be having a whole lot of rules, Captain Watcher. Really only got the one."
"You look upset. I'm listening."
"What is it?"
"I don't much care, Serafen."
"Upset? Upset ain't the first flogging half of it, captain."
"I don't much care if you don't much care, cap. Words will be had."
"I don't slave. Nor be I serving on any cog-swabbing ship that does. Savvy? Do it again, and I shove off."
"What's your issue with slaving?"
"I haven't been slaving."
"The only person giving orders on my ship is me."
"Let me save you some time. Pack your shit and get off my ship."

"Aye-fucking-aye, captain. And good riddance to you, too."

He spins on his heel and stalks away.
"I'm sorry, Serafen. I won't do it again."
"Oh, I don't know, cap, maybe that it be fucking slaving? Didn't realize not slaving were the type of stand a swabby had to justify."

"I wish I could take your word for it, captain. Just... do better."

He sighs and turns away.

"Here's hoping you don't."

He sighs, swigs from a sack at his side, and turns away.

"You been helping them, though, ain't you? Just as good as doing yourself. As for the Príncipi... they be my problem to deal with."

He shakes his head, an ear twitching.
As if a storm rages beneath his skin, Serafen's nose twitches and fur bristles. Lips curl over crooked teeth.
"I made meself clear on the issue of slavery. Yet here we be again."
"You were serious about that?"
"I'm sorry, Serafen. I swear I won't do it again."
"Go, then."
"You calling me out?"
"Obviously! Serious as a waterline leak!"

"Too late for that, captain. Fool me once, you're the bilge-sucker. Fool me twice, and..."

His palms towards the sky, he shrugs.
"Be lying if I said the thought hadn't crossed my furry blue mind. But I figure the world be needing you."

"Fare-thee-fucking-well, captain. Be praying we don't cross paths again."

He turns and trundles away.

"You've been warned, Captain Watcher."

He turns away.
He snaps out an abrupt salute.
The blue orlan blinks rapidly, left ear twitching.
Hands on his hips and expression grim, Serafen shakes his head.
"I look back, and I ain't but half-sure how we got ourselves here, cap."
"Well, you've gone and marooned us all out here to die, Captain Watcher. Hope you be right happy bout that."
"It be right good to have you on our side. Hope you know we be full behind you."
"And not the normal piratical 'full behind you' where we sail away the moment your back be turned neither."

"Working with the Huana... it ain't the course I'd've charted, but that don't mean your compass be broke neither."

He sighs and scratches the back of his head.
"Coming out here lean and lonesome, sailing us through that mother of storms, landing us here, wherever here be."
"You've a sack and a half on you, you do. No denying that."
"Hope you know what you be doing. Wouldn't've hoisted the same colors meself, but you be well aware of that. Talked meself blue bout it by now."
"I certainly ain't thrilled bout shooting up the lads and lasses of the Príncipi. They ain't perfect by any swabby's sorry count, but they be family all the same."
"Not that I were aiming to sink all them Huana thrice-over and twice again. Fucking shame, that."
"Probably a lesson to be learned there. Couldn't say what, though."
"Can't say I didn't enjoy showing them company bastards the size of our cannonballs, though."
"Taught those shits from Rauatai a thing or two bout sailing, though, aye captain?"
"What do you mean?"
"On a boat."
"We flew a boat through the Beyond. What's confusing about that?"
"We were all three sheets sodden, I think."
"You too? Might be that explains my missing bottles."
"I've half a mind to be giving the damn things up."
"Only everything."
"Whatever happens, I'm glad you're here."
"You ready for what comes next?"
"I'm going to do my best to get us all through this."
"Let's go. We have a god to find."
"Thanks for the vote of confidence."
"We'll get through this. I swear it."
"Nobody dragged you here, Serafen."
"I could see to your dying right now, if you'd like."
"You've got my arms and my mind. Here's hoping that be more than enough."
"Might not be the best time for the swearing of oaths. You may needs be square with the gods sooner than you'd like."
"Fair. There be blame enough to go thrice round and half again."
"Nay, no need for that. Sure we'll be getting there in our own time."
"Trying to seduce me, cap?"
"Somebody had to be keeping your specter-speaking ass alive."
"I know, cap. Here's hoping it be enough."
"Aye-aye, cap."
"Ain't nobody ready for what be coming down this road, captain. Don't mean it ain't coming."
"Onwards then, cap. To the bitter end and beyond."
"Let's get to doing whatever fool thing we came here to do."
